intro: Ibatia xerohylica, commonly known as the red-barked tree, is a species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red fruits containing a single seed. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
